result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Shodeen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay total fine/costs/surcharges at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/15/17 or penalty of 18 day Huber for non payment
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Shodeen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Loshaw advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant
Filed in Court on 10/4/17

Defendant Michael R Shodeen in court with attorney Kelsey Loshaw.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files an Amended Information. Court previously allowed a deferred prosecution for the Defendant to enter Drug Treatment Court. Defendant has graduated Drug Treatment Court. The Court will accept the amended information. Court will find the defendant guilty of Count #1 of the Amended Information. State makes recommendations. Atty. Loshaw makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

FINE:  $767.00    

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/15/17. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 18 days in Huber.

Defendant Michael R Shodeen in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations as to the drug treatment court contract.  Probation agent makes statements.   Court addresses previous plea taken on 6/13/2016 and dismisses and read in count #2 as of that date.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.
